messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: The Prime Minister will be either David Cameron or Ed Miliband with no third way. The choice lies between competence with the Conservatives and M. Afzal or chaos under Labour with higher taxes, more borrowing and more debt. The last five years have seen a massive Government boost for Manchester with extending Metrolink, major investment in higher education buildings, a regional hub promoting Manchester as a global hub. I believe the Conservative Party is best placed to create jobs and improve living standards by building on an economic plan that is working and that has produced the highest employment rate in history.

messages.title: Vote Conservative
messages.content: To continue on the road of economic recovery vote Conservative on May 7th.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Claims that more people are in work than ever before and a stronger NHS.

Plans to create a Northern Powerhouse to reinvest in Manchester is great news for the city. Billions promised by the Chancellor, George Osborne, will secure billions of pounds of investment in transport, science and industry.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Creating jobs and getting people off welfare
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Backing small businesses that estimate 110,000 more jobs are forecasted to be created in Manchester over the next decade. The number of people across Manchester claiming Job Seekers Allowance fell by more than 40% last year with the jobs created through the economic recovery.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Securing the future of our National Health Service
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invested £12.7 billion since 2010 with an extra £2 billion per year to come. Conservative plans to devolve care budget to local area as the only sensible option and promises action for local residents as they are taken at a very high level.

issues.economy: Record economic growth, more people in work than ever before
issues.education: A massive Government boost...major investment in higher education buildings
issues.governance: Competence with the Conservatives and M. Afzal or chaos under Labour with higher taxes, more borrowing and more debt.
issues.health: Securing the future of our National Health Service with investments and plans for devolving care budget.
issues.socialWelfare: Getting people off welfare, with jobs created and Job Seekers Allowance claims reduced by more than 40%.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe the Conservative Party is best placed to create jobs and improve living standards by building on an economic plan that is working and that has produced the highest employment rate in history.

politicalExperience.role: Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for Manchester Gorton

quotes.text: Official: The fastest growing major economy in 2014
